title: Advice about software
content:
Hello everyone!

I’m new in this site, I work as interior designer and work occasionally with Photoshop and corel draw to create presentations and photo compositions. Now I need to create a logo, so which program you recommend? One that is powerful and have the right tools, but at the same time is user friendly.

I will appreciate your suggestions.

Thanks

 [‹ Vine to the Trellis](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205013604/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33129 "Go to previous forum topic") [cmyk vs rgb [photoshop] filters and stuff? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205013604/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33088 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ethypos

comments.content:
Illustrator is pretty much the standard for creating logos.

You could do it in Corel Draw - just make sure it stays all vector.

peace
Thank you for the advice, I have a few problems with the bezier tool, but it’s a matter of practice.
